qas.question: On which date was the first Canadian football game for which a written record has survived?
Which team won the first recorded Canadian football game?
What was the first final score recorded of a Canadian football game?
What is the oldest football club in Canada?
Which founder of Milton, MA also helped develop the rules of Canadian football?
The first written account of American football game was on what date?
The second Battalion Scots won the first ever what?

plausible_answers.text: Toronto, F. Barlow Cumberland, Frederick A. Bethune, and Christopher Gwynn

qas.question: Who devise rules based on American football?
What team was formed on April 8, 1827?
What game was instantly popular in Canada?
When was the First Battalion Grenadier Guards formed?
What is the oldest group with devised rules in Canada?
Who won the first game with a following in Canada?
What was the first recorded set of devised rules of a Canadian football game?
Where were the rules based on the Hamilton Football Club created?

context: The first written account of a <b6_0>game played was on <a0_0><b5_0>October 15, 1862<b5_0/><a0_0/>,<b6_0/> on the Montreal Cricket Grounds. It was between the <a1_0><b12_0>First Battalion Grenadier Guards<b12_0/><a1_0/> and the Second Battalion Scots Fusilier Guards resulting in a win by the Grenadier Guards <a2_0><b13_0>3 goals, 2 rouges to nothing<b13_0/><a2_0/>.[citation needed] In 1864, <b14_0>at Trinity College, <b7_0>Toronto<b14_0/>, F. Barlow Cumberland, Frederick A. Bethune, and <a4_0>Christopher Gwynn<b7_0/><a4_0/>, one of the founders of Milton, Massachusetts, devised rules based on rugby football. The game gradually gained a following, with the <a3_0><b11_0>Hamilton <b9_0>Football<b9_0/> Club<b11_0/><a3_0/> formed on <b10_0>November 3, 1869<b10_0/>, (the oldest football club in Canada). <b8_0>Montreal<b8_0/> formed a team April 8, 1872, Toronto was formed on October 4, 1873, and the Ottawa FBC on September 20, 1876.
